column4: Can someone please explain to me how to set my bios to boot from CD so I can run the live disk?
as your machine boots it should offer "press F1 or F12 or delete or some other key" to enter setup
then you get boot order and make machine boot from CDROM first
in Boot Sequence IDE CD-ROM Device is first, followed by Hard-Disk Drive C:
that's how it should be, right?
yes
put the CD in there and start from there
PM please, I'm still having trouble.
keep it public - if someone else ever saw it then they can contribute
did you save it?
usually F10
yes, saved it
then i tried just letting it boot.  no go.
then F12, Boot From IDE CD Device
Still loads XP
can you test the CD in another machine (not to install but to test it boots)
Sure, let me grab my brother's laptop.  I'm using the file downloaded from the website, not any external torrent or the likes.  brb
doesn't seem to boot on other systems either.
get a new CD
i got this one from the link on the ubuntu.com site.
i downloaded the PC files onto a mac, burned them to dvd, and then tried install in PC.  does that have anything to do with the problems I'm having?
back in a minute
okay
